Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • Room

  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for a room which can hold tiles and a robot, opens a window when constructed. Rooms can be laid out in text files, using W for walls, H for hazards, and G for goals. A sample room looks like the following: WWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW W GW WH WWWWWWWWW W W WWWWWWWW HW W W W WWWWWWWWW WH W WWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Room()
      Constructs a new, default room, 20 tiles wide and 20 tiles tall
      Room(java.lang.String filename)
      Constructs a new room with tiles taken from the text file with the given name

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(int x, int y, Tile t)
      Add the given tile at the given x and y coordinates
      Tile[] getAdjacent(Robot r)
      Returns the array of tiles in NESW order which are immediately adjacent to the robot Empty tiles are represented as null.
      void kill()
      Call this method to halt the program but not close the window
      void render()
      Called by the room every tick to update the canvas
      void update(Robot r, int dx, int dy)
      Called by the robot to refresh the room once the robot moves This method handles the proper calculation of scores for hazards/goals

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room()
        Constructs a new, default room, 20 tiles wide and 20 tiles tall

      • Room

        public Room(java.lang.String filename)
        Constructs a new room with tiles taken from the text file with the given name
        Parameters:
        filename - the path to the text file containing the layout for this room

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int x,
                int y,
                Tile t)
        Add the given tile at the given x and y coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, in tiles. Starts at 0 on the left and increases to the right
        y - the y coordinate in tiles. Starts at 0 at the top and increases going downwards
        t - the tile to be added

      • getAdjacent

        public Tile[] getAdjacent(Robot r)
        Returns the array of tiles in NESW order which are immediately adjacent to the robot Empty tiles are represented as null.
        Parameters:
        r - the robot around which the tiles are adjacent
        Returns:
        the array of tiles in NESW order which are immediately adjacent to the robot

      • update

        public void update(Robot r,
                   int dx,
                   int dy)
        Called by the robot to refresh the room once the robot moves This method handles the proper calculation of scores for hazards/goals
        Parameters:
        r - the robot which called the method
        dx - the change in x the robot wants to move
        dy - the change in y the robot wants to move

      • render

        public void render()
        Called by the room every tick to update the canvas

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Call this method to halt the program but not close the window
